subject: Gardening
title: Habitat Niches in Small Spaces
description: A 60-second lesson on Habitat Niches in Small Spaces.

hook.text: A pile of logs in the corner of your garden isn't messâ€”it's a five-star hotel for beetles, frogs, and fungi.

buildup.text: Every garden feature creates micro-habitats: stone walls harbor lizards, leaf litter shelters ground beetles.

discovery.text: Research shows gardens with diverse physical structures support 50-70% more species than tidy, uniform ones.

twist.text: The obsession with tidiness destroys habitat. Raking every leaf and removing every stick eliminates overwintering sites.

climax.text: Ecological gardening means creating habitat diversityâ€”leaving some mess, some water, some shelter in every garden.

punchline.text: A messy corner is the most biodiverse garden feature.

quiz.question: How much more species can gardens with diverse physical structures support?
